item.title: When in doubt, check your routes
item.description: One of the cool things you can do when launching aws ec2 instances is add a configuration script that will run during launch. From the launch configuration wizard, this script is on the ‘Configure Instance Details’ step under ‘Advanced Details’. A common script that I’ve been using lately with all of my labs is installing, starting, and enabling the apache web server aka httpd. #!/bin/bash sudo yum update -y sudo yum install -y httpd php sudo systemctl start httpd sudo systemctl enable httpd This is just a batch script that will update yum, install apache and php, start the httpd daemon and enable it to start on next boot.
